intro: Heeria nigricans var. elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed heeria, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, spherical berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens.
